item.title: Rad Power Bikes’ batteries receive major fire risk warning
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: The U.S Consumer Product Safety Commission claims Rad Power "refused to agree to an acceptable recall." Rad Power says the CPSC's solution would bankrupt the company.

item.title: Tesla FSD software may not be approved by EU regulator after all
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Tesla claimed in a weekend social media post that a Dutch regulator was set to approve its Full Self-Driving mode. It seems the regulator isn't quite in line with Tesla.

item.title: Hands on with Stickerbox, the AI-powered sticker maker for kids
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Stickerbox turns kids’ ideas into printable stickers, blending AI magic with hands-on coloring for a surprisingly creative, "screen-light" play experience.

item.title: AWS is spending $50B build AI infrastructure for the US government
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: AWS has been working with the U.S. government since 2011 and is now building AI infrastructure specifically for the entity.

item.title: Anthropic releases Opus 4.5 with new Chrome and Excel integrations
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: Anthropic has launched Opus 4.5, the latest version of its flagship model, with new integrations into Chrome and Excel.

item.title: X-energy rides nuclear wave, raises $700M Series D
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: The small modular reactor startup is capitalizing on surging interest from tech companies and data center developers.

item.title: DOGE days are over as Trump disbands Elon Musk’s team of federal cost-cutters
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: DOGE members are reportedly worried that they could face prosecution for some of their activities conducted while under the leadership of Elon Musk.

item.title: Pocket Casts now lets you create a playlist of your favorite podcast episodes
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Pocket Casts now lets you create playlists for putting podcasts episodes in your desired listening order.

item.title: A new AI benchmark tests whether chatbots protect human wellbeing
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Most AI benchmarks measure intelligence and instruction-following rather than psychological safety. Humane Bench evaluates models based on core principles of human flourishing, prioritizing wellbeing, and respecting user attention.

item.title: Facebook takes on Reddit with launch of nicknames for Facebook Groups
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Facebook users can protect their privacy in Groups using a new nicknames feature.

item.title: Former MrBeast content strategist is building an AI tool for creator ideation and analytics
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Palo is a tool for short-video creators to gain insights into what is working for them.

item.title: US banks scramble to assess data theft after hackers breach financial tech firm
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: U.S. banking giants including JPMorgan Chase, Citi, and Morgan Stanley are working to identify what data was stolen in a recent cyberattack on a New York financial firm.

item.title: Malaysia may ban users under 16 from social media starting next year
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description: The country's communications minister Fahmi Fadzil said the administration is considering systems for implementing age restrictions on social media sites.

item.title: Momentic raises $15M to automate software testing
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: AI testing startup Momentic has raised $15 million in a Series A round led by Standard Capital, with participation from Dropbox Ventures. Existing investors at Y Combinator, FCVC, Transpose Platform and Karman Ventures also participated.

item.title: This startup wants to build a fusion reactor — on a boat
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Startups are still racing to build the world's first commercial fusion power plant on land, but Maritime Fusion thinks the path will be easier out at sea.

item.title: Revolut hits $75B valuation in new capital raise
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description: The deal was led by Coatue, Greenoaks, Dragoneer, and Fidelity. Investors including Nvidia's NVentures, Andreessen Horowitz, Franklin Templeton, and other backers advised by T. Rowe Price Associates also participated.

item.title: Roblox CEO interview gets heated over child safety
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: The interview began with Baszucki describing the feature, which will require all users to submit a face scan if they want to access Roblox’s messaging features. But by the time he was asked about a report claiming the company had prioritized growth over safety, Baszucki seemed to tire of the topic.

item.title: X’s new About this account feature is going great
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: While X’s new “About this account” feature includes information about when a user joined and how they downloaded the app, geographic location is getting the most attention by far.

item.title: AI is too risky to insure, say people whose job is insuring risk
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Major insurers including AIG, Great American, and WR Berkley are asking U.S. regulators for permission to exclude AI-related liabilities from corporate policies. One underwriter describes the AI models’ outputs to the FT as "too much of a black box."

item.title: TechCrunch Mobility: Searching for the robotaxi tipping point
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Welcome back to TechCrunch Mobility — your central hub for news and insights on the future of transportation.
